Planet Coaster 2 is a good game,
at first.
I do enjoy it, and think there's still way more for me to discover - however, it does have its problems. Some things glitch for seemingly no reason, like workers not responding even if they have nothing scheduled and aren't on break, or guests not being able to enter the park at all even though the rest of them can.

That said, I do still love this game. This isn't a bad review for a reason. The UI is just absolute bliss, the rides are interesting, and there's DLC for days so you never get bored! The campaign keeps you hooked, with fully voiced NPC's to guide you if you're stuck! If you get frustrated with the campaign, you can try your hand at the sandbox mode or just making your own park from scratch. There's a lot to do in this game, and I am still discovering it. But putting the main negatives aside, it truly is a wonderful game, you just have to be a liiiiittle patient haha!

This game has something for everyone, but you won‚Äôt enjoy it if you‚Äôre not a creative person. There‚Äôs sandbox mode if you want to build your dream ride, park, or simply screw around. Franchise mode if you‚Äôre a tryhard, and career if you don‚Äôt feel like building the entire park, just fixing and managing existing ones.

You can discover other players parks, and watch as others discovers yours. A special shoutout to the planet coaster 2 facebook group where lovely people share builds and ask questions.

I‚Äôm one of those that shouldn‚Äôt like this game. I‚Äôm not a theme park nerd, I don‚Äôt care too much about rollercoasters. But the freedom this game gives you, while still challenging your management skills, is imo unmatched. There‚Äôs only one other game I‚Äôd say lives up to planco 2 and that would be Planet zoo, unsurprisingly.

The devs have made sure this game did not flop and keep improving it. Sure dlcs suck but at least they‚Äôre still dropping updates for everyone. I‚Äôm excited to see what the future holds for this game, and I‚Äôm glad to recommend it (despite my disappointment on launch‚Ä¶ üò≥)

Very fun but very frustrating at times.
Here are some of the things that I have experienced:
- Game crashes (sometimes without even loading a saved game or starting a new one....just launch it and wait for the crash). This has only happened 2-3 times and may be fixed (now I just immediately select a game to avoid waiting on the main menu).
- Gondola transport ride just stops and cannot be restarted without exiting the game and relaunch. There is no service required and all stations have staff assigned.
- Trying to do some detail work with a lot of scenery around can be a bit frustrating. Sometimes zooming in can cause the camera to instantly be moved very far away.
- Playing on the Steam Deck or a PC with a controller is definitely more frustrating than using a mouse and keyboard. This is very apparent when adjusting staff schedules going into advanced options and setting the zone and workstation. Trying to apply the changes to "All day" results in being sent back to the full staff schedule just to find that the change did not happen. The only workaround is to manually set each 1 hour shift separately. This gets old very fast.
- The in-game help is not very helpful. Example: try to find out how to keep people in the pool away from the flume/slide exits. Many more instances of there not being enough detail in the in-game help to actually solve a problem that many users experience.

The above issues are only some that I experienced.

There are a lot of things that still need to be worked out but overall the game is still pretty fun just be prepared for a little frustration from time to time. For now, I'll still recommend the game. If Frontier does not address some/all of the issues in the next 6-12 months, I may change my recommendation.

Cheers

[h1] An incredible game that redeemed itself from its rocky launch to become an amazing theme park sandbox.[/h1]
Over the course of the year Planet Coaster 2 has gone from a messy console focused tycoon game with flawed mechanics to an outstanding sandbox for the creation of any coaster. The coaster creation UI helps new players understand the basics while letting those who want to go off the deep end create masterpieces of storytelling.

Thanks to its many free updates the game allows you to customize challenge scenarios to your liking and features almost every original scenery theme from the first game.  However, the water and electricity management aspects of the game can be a  turn off for veterans of the first game or those who want a less management heavy game which thankfully may be disabled with ease when making a challenge scenario.

Overall if your interested in creating highly themed roller coasters and rides planet coaster 2 is one of the best options out there, with much more support planned for the future with a teased second year of content updates both free and paid [b]Planet Coaster 2 might be what your looking for.[/b]

I'll start off by saying I'm enjoying this game but there's several things irritating me and keeping me from fully loving it (and giving a thumbs up). 

-Bugs: Way too many bugs still. PC1 never was this bad at least from what I can recall. Especially at this price point. Some things are game breaking.

- Breakdowns make no sense: Seems as long as you keep renewing this service badge, rides will never, ever break down. I miss in the OG RCT seeing coaster trains stuck on lifts, restraints stuck open or closed, etc.

- Goofy pricing: Guests will pay $50 + to ride 1 ride if it has scenery. There's no option to charge park entry and keep rides free. RCT did this perfectly and added some multiplier that made it sustainable to run a park like this if you chose to. (Parks don't charge per ride anymore)

- Multi color coaster trains: If you have 2 + trains on a coaster there's no option to select colors for each one. Such a simple thing that's in all the other games except this one. Very irritating.

- Transfer tracks: With the added electricity element it costs more to run more trains on coasters - there is still no ability to add & take off coaster trains without closing entire ride. I wouldn't even care if there was no animation; let us do this!

- Lack of variables: Parkitect does this PERFECTLY. You'll randomly get news like "Merry go round went viral on social media - expect extra crowds for this ride" or "there's a shortage of salt. food costs will go up". And they are very random and there's a bunch of em to keep the game fresh.

- Lights (still) can't snap to paths: It's way too tedious to place lights. Give an option to snap em to the path or include them in the auto placement option when making paths.

- No scenario editor: This gives the game way more replay value with ability to share scenarios and empty parks. The first one had it, why not this one?! I want more to do when I finish career mode!

- Lack of shops: Still only 3 from the first one. I don't even care if it's shops where guests buy stuff you really can't see but it shows in the guest inventory (like Parkitect), just make more shops with different items!

- Menus are janky: Doing certain things require too many clicks and don't make sense. The UI just isn't the most user friendly. 

- No option to resize parks in sandbox. 

- Closing park causes all guests to leave line: In the first one, closing a park, guests in line would stay and finish their ride then leave (which is how it should be) - now they just all leave. I loved simulating days / seasons in PC1 - I hope this gets fixed / updated.

- No theme maker toolkit: Again, if it was in the first one, why is it not in this one?! There's many things I don't feel like making myself and its much easier to get stuff from the workshop. 

- Weather seems broken: I have yet to see it rain once. I have it enabled. 

- No RNG terrain maker: Would love an option to generate random terrain. I personally don't like starting with a flat empty park in sandbox. Give option for us to generate random maps. 

STUFF I ENJOY:
- Pools + Slides: probably just a fun as the coasters to build and one of my fav things to create.
- Scenery stamper: Makes placing scenery sooo much easier! You can even make custom brushes with your own items!
- Separate load + unload stations for coasters: finally they listened to something!
- Onride photos
- Better coaster smoothing.

This game needs a lot more love and I hope to see it. The bugs are the big thing but stuff that seems like common sense to add to a game like this just isn't there yet.

There is retread on a lot of the items that are brought over from 1. Many of the features of placed items in the first game are weirdly tweaked so they are not as customizable.  For instance - shop menus.... There are little icons of ingredients but it will take you a bit of digging to figure out what the icon represents... i.e. gluten is bread, a cup means caffeine, etc.  And sometimes you can't change them even if customers don't want them. I continue to be very disappointed and likely will just go back to playing Planet Coaster 1 and be sad about spending $50 on a game I dislike so much.

Not Recommended

This feels like a game designed for consoles. The controls are clunky on keyboard/mouse, the tutorial is terrible and the limit on only 6000 guests in most modes basically renders any modern CPU or GPU irrelevant. The overpriced DLC leaves a bitter taste in the mouth and i'm glad i waited for a sale to try this game. Having said that, it feels like a waste of $30.
